I teach 10th grade students communication and presentation skills

I am responsible for helping reform K12 education systems by representing the power that technology can play in that reform effort.  As part of the Google Apps for Education Team, I manage our K12 global strategy and approach.  We are currently focused on the US and I work with states and large school districts that are working on bringing those 21st Century tools into the classroom.  The primary tool we use for this effort is G Suite.  G Suite's advanced collaboration and communication tools make it easy to help students acquire the skills that will help them soar, in their education and out in the world. There's no hardware to maintain or software to install, no ads, and no cost for schools.We do all of this for free.  We want to help build the skills required for tomorrow's work.  We want to help close the digital divide, not only in our country, but in the world.  We want to help level the playing field.

Accomplishments include: Created and implemented an employee development strategy for the CIO and Executive Vice President of Technology and Operations, resulting in the identification and closure of gaps and the creation of development opportunities for the organization’s top performer.  Participated as the only non-officer on Schwab’s Human Resource Redesign Team, a team charged with streamlining and reengineering the HR function, resulting in annualized savings of more than $5 million and head count reduction of 20%.  Asked by the HR Executive Vice President to join the Talent Management and Development Team to build a Change Management capability for Schwab’s HR Generalist population, resulting in the development and training rollout of these competencies.

Assisted a number of small business and non-profits with the creation of process improvement strategies and technology implementation plans, resulting in clear actionable project plans.Facilitated a number of organizational leadership sessions, resulting in the creation of a shared vision and key priorities.  Provided onsite consultation to Newmont Mining Corporation’s Community Relations, Communications, and Human Resources Department in Denver, helping develop and implement a number of critical programs and projects.Assisted Newmont create a global HR transformation strategy, resulting in the implementation and roll out of improved HR policies, procedures, and new global programs.Created Newmont’s internal communication infrastructure and templates (translated in four languages), focused on tools and templates management used to facilitate internal communications across the global organization.Wrote Newmont’s annual sustainable development report, focused on best sustainability practices across the global company.

Developed and implemented technology, human performance, organizational development solutions for clients including, American Express, US Postal Service, Bank of America, United Health Group, Seagate Technology, Motorola, Boeing, KANA, Sun Micro Systems, and Accenture (examples below).Part of team that created new credit card infrastructure system for American Express, resulting in the reduction in credit card launch cycles from two years to four months.Part of team that reengineered and automated Seagate’s three separate global human resource functions, resulting in one global HR function, with new processes, new technology systems, and a trained HR team.Assisted in the development and implementation of Accenture’s new Business Development Methodology, resulting in a consistent consulting methodology for 60,000 consultants around the world (our team won the Gartner "Best New Internal Program Rollout" award).Part of team that reengineered and automated United Heath Group’s administration processes, resulting in a savings of 15% from overall costs.Part of team that reengineered the United States Postal Service Business Reply Mail process, resulting in a streamlined organization and faster process that lead to a 20% recoup in lost revenue.Part of team that created the Accenture employee retention program focused on all 70,000 employees, resulting in a reengineered performance management process that saved thousands of FTE hours and a new compensation model focused on retaining top performers.Led Phoenix Accenture diversity team, resulting in a diversity awareness campaign, diversity communication program, and a minority retention program replicated across several Accenture offices.

summary: Jaime Casap is the Education Evangelist at Google. Jaime evangelizes the power and potential of technology and the web as enabling and supporting tools in pursuit of promoting inquiry-driven project-based learning models. Working with the Google for Education Team, Jaime collaborates with school systems, educational organizations, and leaders focused on building innovation and iteration into our education policies and practices. He speaks on education, technology, innovation, and generation z, at events around the world.In addition to his role at Google, Jaime serves on a number of boards for organizations focused on education, innovation, and equity.  He is on the Board of Inquiry Schools, Seed Spot NEXT, and Mi Familia Vota.  He is part of the Phoenix Union School District Team, who created the Phoenix Coding Academy, an inquiry-based high school designed with computer science as the core language for all students.  Jaime is also an adjunct professor at Arizona State University, where he teaches classes on policy, innovation, and leadership.You can follow and reach him on Twitter at @jcasap
